Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but
not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/18/24, a youth was not listening and a staff member
threatened to hit the youth. The youth continued to hit the staff
member and the staff retaliated by hitting the youth in the
face/neck area. They were separated by staff. Staff member was
terminated.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/23/2024 Special Investigation was initiated onsite at Vista
Maria. An interview was completed with Compliance. He
advised that Youth A was no longer placed at the agency and
Staff 1 had been terminated. A request for any incident reports,
video footage and policy information was made. Compliance
advised he would provide the requested documents. He further
confirmed that he had reviewed video footage and saw Staff 1
hitting Youth A on the video.
The following interviews were completed on 12/23/2024 at
Visita Maria, unless otherwise noted.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed. Both youth denied
witnessing Staff 1 hitting Youth A, but reported that Youth A told
them about the incident. Youth B and Youth C denied any
concerns with Staff 1 and also denied that they had personally
witness her being inappropriate for other youth in the facility.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were interviewed. Both denied knowledge of
Staff 1 hitting Youth A. They also denied knowledge of any staff
using inappropriate discipline with Youth A. They did however,
report that Youth A is a resident that intentionally attempts to push
the buttons of staff.
On 12/30/2024 an email was sent to Foster Care Worker (FCW)
inquiring about any concerns with former placement of Youth A.
FCW responded via email and denied that she had any additional
concerns.
2

On 12/30/2024 a voicemail message was left for Complainant to
return call with any additional information.
On 01/08/2025, 01/28/2025 and 02/14/2025 a telephone message
was left for Staff 1 requesting a return call regarding her
employment at Visita Maria and interaction with Youth A. To date
a response has not been received.
On 01/28/2025 Compliance sent an email advising that Staff 5 is
out on medical leave.
On 02/14/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 6.
He confirmed that he is employed at Vista Maria and was present
on 12/18/2024 when the incident occurred. He recalled that Youth
A had taken the shoe of Staff 1. Staff 1 was upset and attempted
to get her shoes back. He reported that Youth A was escalated
and not responding to redirection by staff. He indicated that only
Staff 1 and Staff 6 were present and there were no other youth
present. Staff 6 reported that Staff 1 was attempting to obtain her
shoe from Youth A and she was hit by the youth. Staff 6 reported
that Staff 1 stated “I’m gonna lose my job today”. Staff 6 stated he
attempted to redirect the staff and encourage her to leave the
area, but she refused and began to hit Youth A repeatedly. He
stated after about 45 seconds to a minute, he was able to
convince Staff 1 to leave the area. Staff 6 denies that he has ever
seen Staff 1 respond in that manner.
On 02/14/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 5.
She advised that she remains employed with Vista Maria but was
not present at the time of the physical portion of the incident. She
recalls that she was originally called to the scene to assist but had
to switch out with Staff 1 because Youth A became physical with
her, threw an object at her, and punched her in the jaw. She
recalled that she left at that time and returned when Youth A
calmed down. She confirmed that she wrote the incident report
based on what she witnessed and what was reported to her by
Staff 1. Staff 5 then reported that on either 12/19/24 or 12/20/24
she overheard some other youth at Vista state that it was unfair
that Staff 1 had hit Youth A but was still working there and did not
get into any trouble. Staff 5 reported she then went to her
supervisor and advised of what she had heard. This led to
Compliance looking for any possible incidents on the stored video
footage. Staff 5 reported she then contacted Staff 6 to inquire
about the incident that was seen on camera footage. Staff 6 was
advised by both Staff 5 and Compliance that because he was the
staff that witnessed Staff 1 hitting Youth A, he needed to call the
3

complaint in to centralized intake. Staff 5 confirmed that no
incident report relative to Youth A being hit by Staff 1 had been
completed.
On 02/14/2025 a video interview was completed with Youth A.
She confirmed that she was previously placed at Vista Maria.
Youth A reported that she did not get along well with Staff 1. She
recalled that on the day of the incident she took the shoe of Staff
1. She also recalled hitting Staff 1 and then Staff 1 began to hit
her back. She reported she was hit several times in the face, but
did not have any marks or bruises at the end. Youth A reported
that she did not see a doctor on this day. She reported this was
the first time Staff 1 hit her and denied that she has seen Staff 1
engage with other youth in this manner. Youth A reported the
other staff that was present when she was hit by Staff 1 was Staff
6. Youth A denied that Staff 6 hit her and denied that she has
seen him hit other youth. Lastly Youth A denied that she reported
the incident to any other staff or discussed it with other residents.
Documents Reviewed
Vista Maria Incident Report – IR was dated for 12/18/2024 and
indicated incident occurred around 5:10 pm. The IR has the
subject title of Youth assaulted Staff. On the above date and
approximate time Staff 5 went onto B wing due to a clear
(segregation for safety) being called. When Staff 5 got on the wing
and Youth A was by the kitchen door. Staff 5 was able to get
Youth A away from the kitchen door. Youth A then stated
that she wanted to kill herself. Staff 5 began to clean up the unit
and Youth A threw a silicone toy at Staff 5 and hit her in the face.
A few moments later, Youth A punched Staff 5 in the left jaw. Staff
5 then swapped out with Staff 1. Youth A started to chase Staff 1
around the wing and Staff 1 tripped on a mattress. The shoe of
Staff 1 came off and Youth A picked it up and ran. Staff 1 and
Staff 6 asked for the shoe back and Youth A refused. After
several minutes Staff 6 was able to get the shoe back from Youth
A. She then became physically aggressive with Staff 1 and
punched her in the face twice. Staff 1 then switched out with two
other staff who were able to calm Youth A down. Staff 5 and Staff
1 both completed employee injury reports and went to Concentra.
Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – Policy indicates
Prohibited Behavior Intervention Practices. Vista Maria strictly
prohibits excessive or inappropriate use of behavior management
intervention. Behavior management interventions will not be used
as a form of discipline or to force compliance, for the convenience
of staff, or for property damage that does not involve threatening
4

danger to self or others. Prohibited Verbal Practices include but
are not limited to:
• Use of profanity or abusive language directed at or in the
presence of clients.
• Harsh or degrading language directed at a client.
Prohibited Physical Intervention Practices include but are not
limited to:
• Personal physical intervention shall not be imposed as a
means of coercion, discipline, convenience, or retaliation by
staff.
• Seclusion (secured or by verbal directive) preventing a
client’s egress from the designated area will not be utilized.
• The use of noxious substances, instruments that cause
temporary incapacitation, and any type of chemical physical
interventions.
• When a client’s individual treatment plan and/or safety plan
indicates adverse effects from physical intervention.
• Prone, supine, and any other physical intervention
technique utilized that may constrict a youth’s breathing.
• Mechanical restraints of any nature (hand cuffs, shackles,
etc.) will not be utilized.
• Four-point restraints and any type of restraint “chair”.
Behavior management interventions by clients or untrained
staff.
• The use of backwards transport will not be utilized.
• Leg/ankle restriction or physical intervention.
• Wrist physical intervention behind the back.
Human Resources/Discipline file of Staff 1 – Staff 1 has been
employed with the agency since February 6, 2024. She has
received discipline for the following:
• Written Warning – 7/17/24: violation of Employee Behavior
and Supervision policies
• Verbal Warning – 5/16/24: violation of Employee Behavior
policy
• Memo of Understanding – 4/16/24: violation of Employee
Behavior Policy
Video Review:
Video is dated for 12/18/2024 with a time stamp of 5:15 pm.
Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 6 are seen in the video. Youth A
appears to have an object, possibly a shoe, in her hand. Staff 1 is
seen attempting to get the object from Youth A, who is refusing to
hand it over. Staff 6 is seen trying to intervene and stepping in
between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A hits Staff 1 in the face and
Staff 1 grabs the arm/wrist of Youth A and then retaliates by hitting
5

Youth A in the face five times. Staff 6 steps in between the two
and directs Staff 1 out of the area.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. As a result of the
interviews completed and video footage reviewed it was clearly
determined that Staff 1 engaged in inappropriate physical
behavior with Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001230 CAP Approved 10/10/2024
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency staff failed to document via incident report the actions of
staff hitting a youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 02/14/2025 Compliance confirmed that there was no incident
report on file that documented Youth A being hit by Staff 1. He
indicated that the incident report on file had been written and
submitted by Staff 6 and indicated that Staff were assaulted by
Youth A.
On 02/14/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 6.
He confirmed that he is employed at Vista Maria and was present
on 12/18/2024 when the incident occurred. Staff 6 reported that
the did not write an incident report because they then transitioned
to another room and he was aware that Staff 5 wrote an incident
report. During the interview, Staff 6 confirmed that Staff 5 was not
in the area when Staff 1 hit Youth A. Staff 6 did not have an
explanation as to why he did not write an incident report.
On 02/14/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 5.
She advised that she remains employed with Vista Maria but was
not present at the time of the physical portion of the incident. She
confirms that she wrote the incident report based on what she
witnessed and what was reported to her by Staff 1.
Documents Interviewed
6

Vista Maria Incident Reporting Policy – Vista Maria employees
must document all critical incidents and any irregular campus
occurrences or events that are inconsistent with routine
operations. An incident report must be completed immediately
following the incident or as soon as possible before the staff exit
for the day. If the staff is unable to complete the incident report
due to urgent or mitigating circumstances, the Shift Supervisor or
Unit/Program Manager must be notified immediately to ensure
completion within 24 hours of occurrence.
Video Review:
Video is dated for 12/18/2024 with a time stamp of 5:15 pm shows
Staff 6 was precent when Staff 1 became physical with Youth A.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, it was determined that the
agency staff failed to complete an incident report documenting the
actions of Staff 1 toward Youth A. The staff was observed to be
hitting and punching Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001298 CAP Approved 10/17/2024
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency failed to make report of suspected abuse or neglect to
centralized intake.
Investigation Interviews:
On 02/14/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 5.
She advised that she remains employed with Vista Maria but was
not present at the time of the incident. She advised that a report
of suspected abuse or neglect was not called in until 12/21/2024,
three days after the incident.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Child Protection Law Compliance Policy – Vista Maria
has a zero tolerance for child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse and
harassment of clients and staff. All Vista Maria staff are required
to immediately report to Child Protective Service any incident
where they have reasonable cause to suspect that sexual abuse
7

and harassment, child abuse or neglect (see definitions below)
has occurred as follows:
1. both verbally and in writing to their immediate supervisor,
2. by phone call immediately to Child Protective Services and
3. followed by a written report (DHS 3200) within 24 hours.
Intake ID associated with assigned special investigation –
Confirms that report was made on Saturday December 21, 2024,
which was three days after the event occurred.
Video Review:
Video dated for 12/18/2024 with a time stamp of 5:15 pm shows
Staff 1 grabs the arm/wrist of Youth A and then retaliates by hitting
Youth A in the face five times.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation the agency staff was found
to have failed to follow agency policy of making an immediate
referral to centralized intake due to suspicion of abuse and/or
neglect. The agency was found to be in non-compliance with
licensing rule 4131-1.
Conclusion Violation Established
2024SIC0001298 CAP Approved 10/17/2024
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A CAP is required.
